content: ZONE A - COMMERCIAL DISTRICT: Zone A is designated for commercial activities including retail stores, restaurants, offices, and service establishments. Residential use is prohibited in Zone A unless granted special variance.
ZONE A HEIGHT LIMITS: Buildings in Zone A shall not exceed 6 stories or 75 feet in height, whichever is less. Rooftop mechanical equipment may extend an additional 15 feet above the height limit.
ZONE A LOT COVERAGE: Maximum lot coverage in Zone A-Commercial shall be 80% of the total lot area. Green space or landscaping must comprise at least 10% of the lot.
ZONE A PARKING: Commercial establishments in Zone A must provide 1 parking space per 300 square feet of floor area. Restaurants must provide 1 parking space per 4 seats plus 1 space per 2 employees.
ZONE B - MIXED USE DISTRICT: Zone B permits both commercial and residential uses. Ground floor commercial with upper-floor residential is encouraged. Standalone residential buildings are permitted.
ZONE B HEIGHT LIMITS: Buildings in Zone B shall not exceed 4 stories or 50 feet for residential structures. Mixed-use buildings may reach 5 stories or 60 feet maximum.
ZONE B HEIGHT EXCEPTION: Residential buildings in Zone B may be limited to 2 stories when located within 500 feet of Zone R-1 boundaries to maintain neighborhood character.
ZONE B SETBACKS: Front setback minimum 15 feet. Side setbacks minimum 10 feet each. Rear setback minimum 20 feet. Corner lots must maintain 15-foot setbacks on both street-facing sides.

ZONE R-1 - SINGLE FAMILY RESIDENTIAL: Zone R-1 is exclusively for single-family detached dwellings. Each lot must contain only one primary dwelling unit. Home occupations are permitted with restrictions.
ZONE R-1 HEIGHT LIMITS: Structures in Zone R-1 shall not exceed 2.5 stories or 35 feet in height. Chimneys and architectural features may extend 5 feet above the roofline.

ZONE R-1 HOME OCCUPATIONS: Home-based businesses are permitted in Zone R-1 provided: (a) no more than 25% of floor area is used for business, (b) no external signage, (c) no customer visits exceeding 5 per day, (d) no employees other than household residents. Food preparation businesses are generally prohibited.

ZONE R-1 HOME OCCUPATION EXCEPTION: Home-based food businesses (cottage food operations) may be permitted with a Special Use Permit from the Health Department, limited to non-hazardous baked goods and confections.
ZONE R-1 LOT SIZE: Minimum lot size in Zone R-1 is 10,000 square feet (approximately 0.23 acres).
ZONE R-2 - MULTI-FAMILY RESIDENTIAL: Zone R-2 permits single-family homes, duplexes, triplexes, and apartment buildings up to 12 units.
ZONE R-2 HEIGHT LIMITS: Buildings in Zone R-2 shall not exceed 3 stories or 40 feet for structures with 4 or fewer units. Buildings with 5-12 units may reach 4 stories or 50 feet.

ZONE C-1 - NEIGHBORHOOD COMMERCIAL: Zone C-1 is for small-scale commercial serving residential neighborhoods. Permitted uses include small retail, cafes, and professional offices under 5,000 square feet.
ZONE C-1 PARKING: Retail/Office requires 1 space per 250 sq ft; Restaurant/Cafe requires 1 space per 3 seats; Personal services require 1 space per 200 sq ft.
FENCE REQUIREMENTS: Front yard fences in all residential zones shall not exceed 4 feet. Side and rear yard fences may be up to 6 feet.
VARIANCE PROCESS: Property owners may apply for variances by submitting an application to the Zoning Board. Variances require demonstration of hardship.
NON-CONFORMING USES: Existing uses that do not conform to current zoning may continue as legal non-conforming uses. Expansion of non-conforming uses is prohibited.
ENVIRONMENTAL SETBACKS: All structures must maintain a 100-foot setback from wetlands, streams, and designated flood zones.
